Understanding Requirements

By using a requirements-driven development process, companies can prevent time-consuming, costly misunderstandings, and shorten the time required to put a software product on the market.

With the Requirement component, you can create requirements within the application and show the dependencies among them. For example, if one requirement must be fulfilled before a second requirement can be fulfilled, the first can be made a child of the second. If your company enforces process rules, the requirements you establish can also be used to drive the development process.

Administrators and other authorized users can export requirements from CaliberRM and import them into StarTeam. Doing this allows you to integrate advanced requirement management techniques into the development process.

Important: The Help system explains how to use the standard property dialog to create and edit requirements. Depending on how your team has set up the application, you may see a totally different dialog called an alternate property editor (APE).
